skill.name: algorithmic-art
skill.description: Creating algorithmic art using p5.js with seeded randomness and interactive parameter exploration. Use this when users request creating art using code, generative art, algorithmic art, flow fields, or particle systems. Create original algorithmic art rather than copying existing artists' work to avoid copyright violations.

skill.author: anthropics

security_audit.summary: Official Anthropic skill, minimal audit applied. No security issues found in scanned text files. Uses external CDNs for p5.js and fonts, so network access is required at runtime.

content.value_statement: You need original generative art that is reproducible and easy to explore. This skill guides you to craft a philosophy and a p5.js viewer with seeds and parameters.
actual_capabilities: Provides a branded HTML viewer template with sidebar controls and canvas container.
Includes seed input with previous, next, and random buttons in the template.
Includes parameter sliders and color pickers wired to update handlers.
Links p5.js from a CDN and loads Google Fonts in the template.
Supplies a generator template with seeded randomness helpers and utility functions.
limitations: Requires internet access to load p5.js and fonts from CDNs.
Does not generate finished art by itself; users must implement the algorithm.
Does not host or deploy the HTML viewer.
Browser performance limits very high particle counts.

use_cases.title: Prototype new systems
use_cases.description: Create a seeded p5.js sketch with tunable parameters for rapid generative experiments.

use_cases.title: Teach generative logic
use_cases.description: Explain how algorithmic philosophy maps to parameters and emergent behavior in a live viewer.

use_cases.title: Concept exploration
use_cases.description: Demonstrate interactive art variations for presentations using a self contained HTML artifact.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner flow field
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants a simple starter sketch
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a short algorithmic philosophy for a calm flow field and list three parameters with ranges for a seeded p5.js viewer.

prompt_templates.title: Particle drift study
prompt_templates.scenario: User wants moving particles with trails
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a philosophy for drifting particles in a vector field and define parameters for count, speed, trail length, and noise scale.

prompt_templates.title: Subtle concept seed
prompt_templates.prompt: Use the concept of coastal fog as a subtle seed and propose a p5.js system with seeded randomness and gentle parameter controls.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced multi field
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a high craft philosophy for dual interacting fields and specify parameters, color controls, and a regeneration plan for the viewer.

output_examples.input: Create a philosophy and plan for seeded flow fields with adjustable density.
output: Movement name and four paragraph philosophy grounded in seeded emergence
Plan listing parameters with suggested ranges and UI controls
Viewer outline with seed navigation, sliders, and optional color pickers

best_practices: Use seeded randomness and noise for reproducible results.
Keep all tunable parameters in a single object for reset and UI updates.
Regenerate the system when parameters change significantly.
anti_patterns: Copying a specific artist style or protected work.
Removing seed controls that enable reproducibility.
Setting particle counts so high that the browser freezes.

faq.question: What platforms are supported?
faq.answer: Any modern browser that can load p5.js and standard HTML and JavaScript.

faq.question: Are there output limits?
faq.answer: Outputs are guidance and templates, not pre rendered images or hosted files.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into my app?
faq.answer: Yes, embed the single HTML viewer and p5.js code in your project.

faq.question: How is my data handled?
faq.answer: No data storage or external transmission is included in the templates.

faq.question: What if the sketch runs slowly?
faq.answer: Reduce particle counts, simplify calculations, or lower the canvas size.

faq.question: How does it compare to static art tools?
faq.answer: It focuses on procedural systems with reproducible variation, not static image editing.
